error.oidc: There was an error authenticate you via the choosen identity provider.

preview.failed: The preview could not be created

share_read.hint: This folder is shared under the following conditions:

share.hint_add:
A shared folder will be automatically placed into the share members root folder
(This will take some minutes).
share.name: Enter a name for this share
share.hint_remove: If you remove this share it will get back into a normal folder. Share members would not have accesss anymore. This share will be removed from their accounts immediately.
share.group_in_list: ACL group %s is already in list
share.user_in_list: ACL user %s is already in list
share.prompt_remove_share: Do you really want to remove this share %s?</br> All members wouldn't have access anymore to this folder, except you.

share_link.hint_create_url: With a global share link you are able to share a file/folder with everyone even with those who do not have an own login.
share_link.hint_remove_url: If you remove this share, any share links (tokens) will be immediately invalid and can not get restored.
share_link.link_copied: The link has been copied to the clipboard
share_link.global_link_hint: (click link to copy it to clipboard)

message.subject: A balloon link has been shared with you

advanced.prompt_destroy: Would you really like to set the date/time %s for node %s for self destruction?
advanced.readonly: Readonly (No content changes can be made anymore, but you can still modify meta data)

destroy_date_window.title: Set destruction date
destroy_date_window.destroyable: The node will destroy itself at the time specified (Not-restorable!)

error.hint_single: The request turns out in an error. Please try it again.
error.hint_multi: Multiple errors have been occured. It was not possible to process the request for the following nodes:

prompt.force_delete: Do you really want to remove these items (inversable)?
prompt.trash_delete: Do you really want to move these items to the trash (restoreable)?
prompt.restore: Would you like to restore this item?
prompt.untouched: The following selected items would not be touched (These are actually not deleted):
prompt.merge: The following items do already exists within the destination, would you like to override/merge these?
prompt.restore_to_root: The parent node in which you want to restore does not exists or is deleted, would you like to restore the node(s) to your root directory?
prompt.open_big_file: The file %s is large and open it could take a long time, would you like to continue anyway?
prompt.close_save_file: Would you like to save your changes?
prompt.auto_rename_node: A file or directory called %s already exists. Would you like to rename yours to %s?

events.add_collection_reference: A new share {{name}} has been added for you

prompt.trash_delete: Do you really want to undo this event? The item %s will be moved to the trash (restoreable).
prompt.trash_restore: Do you really want to undo this event? The item %s will be restored from the trash.
prompt.rename: Do you really want to undo this event? The item %s will be renamed to %s.
prompt.move: Do you really want to undo this event? The item %s will be moved to %s.
prompt.restore: Do you really want to undo this event? The file %s will be restored to previous version %s.
prompt.unshare: Do you really want to undo this event? This share %s will be converted back into a normal folder.

hint.hint_1: You can fully navigate through your node list using only your keyboard with [UP], [DOWN] and [ENTER] to open a file or change directory.</br>You can also delete Nodes by hitting [DEL] or force delete nodes by hitting [CTRL]+[DEL].
hint.hint_2:
The interface is fully capable of drag&drop. You can actually move nodes into other folders using only your mouse.
You can also drag&drop (multiple) files from your local desktop directly into your current cloud folder or any folder in your current list. Of cource you can also upload files by just hitting the action icon ().
hint.hint_25: Your whole cloud is also reachable via WebDAV. Just access your cloud via any WebDAV client using the URL /webdav.
hint.hint_3: You can select multiple nodes at the same time using [CTRL] + click on a node with your mouse. You can also select a range of nodes using [SHIFT] and click on a node with your mouse. You can then perform actions for all selected nodes like delete or copy. This also works with touch devices instead using your keyboard you have to touch a node a little bit longer than usual.
hint.hint_4: This software has an integrated API, which can perform nearly anything you want. The API interface documentation is available under /doc.
hint.hint_5: You can globally share any node you own which is than reachable by any person in the world given you share the link. You can also protect your shared link with a password and/or add an expiration date/time. Just select a node you would like to share and navigate to share in the right pannel.
hint.hint_6: You can filter your node list using the filter action icon (). You can filter files and folders or make your deleted nodes visible. You can also hide or show hidden files (Files which start with a dot).
hint.hint_7: You can tag all your nodes and you decide how to name all those tags. If you have tagged one node you can click on the tag this will set your client into the search mode and will display all nodes with the same tag. You can also search all nodes with the same tag by activate the search mode and using the filter 'tags'.
hint.hint_8: You can add custom meta data to each node, possible additional meta data are author, copyright, license, coordinate and description. Just select the node you would like to customize and navigate to properties.
hint.hint_9: You can search nodes with specific attributes, just enter attribute:value in the search field. For example: 'name:test', this will search all nodes with the name test or mime:application/pdf will search all your pdf files.
hint.hint_10: Behind your cloud is a big search engine running. All your files are indexed in realtime and you can search through all your content using only the search input field.
hint.hint_11: If you have an older browser which does not support the latest features or you have just a slow system then you should give the legacy webclient /webdav a shot.
hint.hint_12: If you delete a node using the delete action icon () or just hit [DEL], your node will be moved to your trash and is fully restorable. You can either use the deleted filter (Hit the action icon ()) or go to the trash in the main menu on the right side. With both ways you can select deleted nodes and restore them using the action icon (). Your can also force delete nodes (skip trash) by using [CTRL] and [DEL]. Your trash will automatically clean up.
hint.hint_13: You can clone nodes in the current directory, just use the action icons () and paste (). You can also copy selected nodes to any folder your want. It does work the same way as it does on your local system. Just select the nodes, hit () and the navigate to the destination folder and hit paste (). It does work the same way using the cut function ().
hint.hint_14: If you edit content of any file, the old content will not be overwritten instead a new version of the file will be created. Your can always check the files history and restory an old version. Just select the file u would like to restore its content and navigate to history in the right pannel.
hint.hint_15: You can view your detailed storage usage within your profile. Just hover over the user icon () and hit Profile.
hint.hint_16: This webinterface is multilangual. Your can switch between languages in the login mask. It will automatically detect your desired language.
hint.hint_17: If your restore a deleted node, it will automatically get restored at the place where you deleted it before. Your can display deleted nodes via the Trash menu or if you enable the deleted filter via the action icon ()
hint.hint_18: This interface is fully responsive and is able to talk with your entire device pool. You will get all features if you browser with your desktop computer but you can also browser this interface with your tablet or smartphone.
hint.hint_19: This interface is touch friendly, you will have the same user experience as you would have with a desktop computer.
hint.hint_20: You can download multiple nodes at once. You only have to select multiple nodes (Hold CTRL and select all nodes you want or do a range select with SHIFT) and hit the download action icon (). A zip file will be created with your selection.
hint.hint_21: Every time you upload or modify a file a background task will be started to create a preview of your file content. You can see the preview if you select the fiel you want. Indeed there are some file types which are impossible to crate a preview.
hint.hint_22: This interface has a built-in file editor for text files. Your can either create a new empty file via the file action icon () or edit an existing text file. Instead a download or preview it will open the editor if you double click on a node.
hint.hint_23: The whole interface talks completely asynchronous with the server, if a request is currently running you will notice the loader icon () in the top bar. If the interface is currently doing a change or modification you will get a feedback () right next to the loader if the request was successful.
hint.hint_24: You can perform various actions using only your keyboard. [SHIFT]+[N] (add folder), [SHIFT]+[X] (cut), [SHIFT]+[C] (copy), [SHIFT]+[V] (paste), [SHIFT]+[U] (upload), [SHIFT]+[D] (download), [SHIFT]+[A] (add file), [SHIFT]+[R] (undelete).
